intro: Atragene tenuifolia, commonly known as the slenderleaf atragene, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and resilience, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
